p: Next, we determine whether there is any significant difference in the network structures of the “target pathways” between the two groups of patients (“progression” vs “complete remission”). We perform differential network analysis [ 5, 6] of the network of proteins in these representative “target pathways” between the two groups of patients (“progression” vs “complete remission”) using the test statistic given in Equation 1, with Pearson’s correlation coefficients as connectivity scores and absolute distance measure for each of the three cancer types. The p-values of the analysis are reported in Table 1. Based on these results, we have the following findings: the RAS signaling pathway is highly significant ( p-value = 0.026) and MAPK signaling pathway is marginally significant ( p-value = 0.082) in HNSC; for LUAD, PI3K signaling pathway is highly significant ( p-value = 0.013).
